content:
Diagnosis:
Pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma, right temporal lobe
BRAF V600E mutation positive, ATRX retained
Partial resection March 2023

Previous treatment:
Debulking surgery 15 March 2023
Adjuvant BRAF-targeted therapy with Dabrafenib commenced April 2023

Current medications:
Dabrafenib 150mg BD
Levetiracetam 1g BD

Current situation:
Routine surveillance MRI brain 15 April 2024 - stable appearances of residual disease

I reviewed [redacted name] today for routine follow-up. She continues on Dabrafenib with good tolerance and no significant side effects. Her seizures remain well-controlled on current anti-epileptic medication. Performance status remains 0. No new neurological symptoms. Recent surveillance MRI shows stable appearances of residual disease with no evidence of progression.

Examination shows no new neurological deficits. Visual fields full to confrontation. Normal gait.

Plan is to continue current treatment and arrange next surveillance MRI in 3 months. Will review in clinic with results.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: BRAF V600E mutation positive, ATRX retained

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows stable appearances of residual disease

patient_facts.value: No neurological deficits, full visual fields, normal gait

status_updates.value: Right temporal lobe pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma with residual disease post-surgery, stable on BRAF-targeted therapy
Continuing Dabrafenib 150mg BD with good tolerance
Review in clinic with MRI results
